entry.et: Middle English coler, from Anglo-French, from Latin collare, from collum neck; akin to Old English heals neck, and probably to Old English hwēol wheel wheel

def.dt: :a band, strip, or chain worn around the neck: as
:a band that serves to finish or decorate the neckline of a garment
:a short necklace
:a band placed about the neck of an animal
:a part of the harness of draft animals fitted over the shoulders and taking strain when a load is drawn
:an indication of control :a token of subservience
:a protective or supportive device (as a brace or cast) worn around the neck
:clerical collar
:something resembling a collar in shape or use (as a ring or round flange to restrain motion or hold something in place)
:any of various animal structures or markings similar to a collar
:an act of collaring :arrest capture
:to seize by the collar or neck
:arrest grab
:to get control of :preempt we can collar nearly the whole of this market Roald Dahl
:to stop and detain in unwilling conversation collar the guest of honor
:to put a collar on collar a dog
:a flagellated endodermal cell that lines the cavity of a sponge and has a contractile protoplasmic cup surrounding the flagellum called also choanocyte
:of, relating to, or constituting the class of wage earners whose duties call for the wearing of work clothes or protective clothing compare white-collar
:having characteristics associated with blue-collar workers: as
:having, showing, or appealing to unpretentious or unsophisticated tastes a new blue–collar serial … woven around a minor-league baseball team Steven Flax
:dependable and hard-working rather than showy or spectacular a blue–collar athlete
:a conservative Democrat especially in the south who votes the straight Democratic ticket
:a narrow stiffly upright white collar worn buttoned at the back of the neck by members of the clergy
:a collar for a dog
:clerical collar
:a wide flexible snug-fitting necklace
:a large stiff turnover collar
:a collar for animals (as dogs and cats) that contains insecticide for killing fleas
:of, relating to, or involving actions for protecting the natural environment green–collar jobs
